The five factors to develop noble right: Seclusion from sensual pleasures and unskillful qualities, entering and remaining in the first absorption
Entering and remaining in the second absorption, with the fading away of placing the mind and keeping it connected
Entering and remaining in the third absorption, with the fading away of rapture
Entering and remaining in the fourth absorption, giving up pleasure and pain, and ending former happiness and sadness
Properly grasping, attending, bearing in mind, and comprehending with wisdom the meditation that is a foundation for reviewing
The things a mendicant drenches, steeps,: Rapture and bliss born of seclusion
Rapture and bliss born of immersion
The things a mendicant becomes capable o: Clairaudience that is purified and superhuman
Understanding the minds of other beings and individuals
Recollecting many kinds of past lives
Clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman
Realizing the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life
